snippet: A citizens’ brigade has been collecting and categorizing thousands of items that were swept out to sea by a tsunami that crashed into Japan last year.
abstract: Citizens' brigade of volunteers and amateur archaeologists has been fanning out across the West Coast and the Pacific, collecting and categorizing thousands of items that were swept out to sea by the tsunami that devastated Japan in 2011; in some cases the group has been able to track down and return items to their original owners.
lead_paragraph: A citizens’ brigade has been collecting and categorizing thousands of items that were swept out to sea by a tsunami that crashed into Japan last year.

headline.seo: Remnants of Japan’s Tsunami Attract Archaeological Interest
headline.main: Remnants of Japan’s Tsunami Attract an Archaeological Interest
headline.print_headline: Remnants of Japan’s Tsunami Attract an Archaeological Interest
